body.p: Identifying the measures against which an entity makes this quantitative assessment is a matter of judgement. That judgement depends on which measures are of great interest to the primary users of the entity’s financial statements. Examples include measures of the entity’s revenues, the entity’s profitability, financial position ratios and cash flow measures.
